member.name: M:Nokia.Graphics.Imaging.AutoResizeConfiguration.#ctor(System.UInt32,Windows.Foundation.Size,Windows.Foundation.Size,Nokia.Graphics.Imaging.AutoResizeMode,System.Double,Nokia.Graphics.Imaging.ColorSpace)
member.summary: Creates a new resize configuration object for the JpegTools.
member.param: Maximum output buffer size in bytes.

param.name: maxImageSize
param.para: Maximum image size to achieve. The rendered image will fit within this outer bounding box when allowing for rotation. The size must be larger than minImageSize. A maxImageSize of {640, 480} will, for the following different source image sizes, give this maximum size:

param.name: minImageSize
param.para: Minimum image size to achieve. The rendered image will be at least as large as this size in at least one dimension. The size must be smaller than maxImageSize. A minImageSize of {160, 120} will, for the following different source image sizes, give this minimum size:

member.param: One of the AutoResizeModes.
The lowest desired encoding quality. Must be in the range [0.0, 1.0]

Color spacing will affect how the color channels are sub-sampled when encoding the JPEG file. Sub-sampling of the color channels will reduce the resulting file size. YUV 4:2:0 color spacing is recommended for achieving the lowest file size.

member.summary: Auto resize will try to preserve the source encoding quality while shrinking the width and height of the image.

member.summary: Auto resize will try to preserve the highest possible encoding quality while shrinking the width and height of the image. This might be useful if you substantially reduce the size of the image.

member.name: P:Nokia.Graphics.Imaging.BlendFilter.TargetArea
member.summary:
A target area within the background image into which the foreground is image blended. Expressed in the unit coordinate space of the background image, i.e., the top left corner of the background image is at (0, 0), and the bottom right corner is at (1, 1).
controls how the foreground is fitted into the target area. By default, the foreground image is stretched to fit the target area.
If value equals Windows::Foundation::Rect::Empty, or either Width or Height is smaller than or equal to zero, the foreground will be stretched over whole background and aspect ratio will not be preserved.

member.name: P:Nokia.Graphics.Imaging.BlendFilter.TargetAreaRotation
member.summary:
The angle of counter clockwise rotation of around its center, in degrees.
If the has not been set, or doesn't have a positive width and height, this property will be ignored.

member.name: P:Nokia.Graphics.Imaging.BlendFilter.TargetOutputOption
member.summary:
Controls how the foreground is fitted into the target area.
If set to , the foreground image will be resized to fit the target area exactly. If set to , the foreground image will be blended into the target area centered and with the original aspect ratio intact. If set to , the size portion of the target area will be ignored, and the foregound image will be blended in its original size.

member.name: M:Nokia.Graphics.Imaging.ChromaKeyFilter.#ctor(Windows.UI.Color,System.Double,System.Double)

member.param:
The chroma key color that will be made transparent.
The alpha component will be ignored.

Specifies how much variation around the chroma key color will be considered for transparency.
If the color distance is small, only a small variation around the chroma key color will be considered for transparency.
Range [0.0, 1.0].

If the noise suppression level is low, only a small amount of noise will be suppressed.
Range [0.0, 1.0].

member.name: M:Nokia.Graphics.Imaging.ChromaKeyFilter.#ctor(Windows.UI.Color,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new ChromaKeyFilter with specified settings.
member.param:
The chroma key color that will be made transparent.
The alpha component will be ignored.

Specifies how much variation around the chroma key color will be considered for transparency.
If the color distance is small, only a small variation around the chroma key color will be considered for transparency.
Range [0.0, 1.0].

Specifies the noise suppression level.
If the noise suppression level is low, only a small amount of noise will be suppressed.
Range [0.0, 1.0].

Controls how the alpha channel is generated.
If false, full transparency in the resulting alpha channel is the value 0.
If true, full transparency in the resulting alpha channel is the value 255.

member.summary: Creates and initializes a new CropFilter with a specified crop area.
member.param:
The crop area.
The coordinates are relative to the current coordinate system, which may be affected by preceding filters. The crop area can only be within the image area, otherwise ArgumentException will be thrown when applying the filter.
The crop area has to be within the image area, range x: [0, min(16383, image width)] y: [0, min(16383, image height)].
If the crop area has a width or height of 0, this filter will not be applied.

member.name: T:Nokia.Graphics.Imaging.ExposureFilter
member.summary: Adjust the brightness of an image using one of the modes in ExposureMode.

member.name: M:Nokia.Graphics.Imaging.ExposureFilter.#ctor
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new ExposureFilter with default values.

member.name: M:Nokia.Graphics.Imaging.ExposureFilter.#ctor(Nokia.Graphics.Imaging.ExposureMode,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new ExposureFilter with specified mode and gain.
member.param: The exposure mode.

The desired exposure level.
Positive values will make the image brighter, negative values will make it darker.
Range is [-1.0, 1.5], but for gamma mode the effect saturates at 1.0, which means that everything between [1.0, 1.5] will be interpreted as 1.0.
Recommended range for both gamma and natural mode for normal usage is [-1.0, 1.0]. 0.0 equals no change of exposure.

summary.para: Segments the source image into foreground and background guided by user provided annotations. The output is a black and white mask where white areas represent the foreground and black areas represent the background.
This class should be used as an effect in the rendering chain, on par with and .
The segmenter can be used to provide a mask for one of the other filters or effects, such as or .

User input is required for segmentation in form of an AnnotationsSource image, that should contain pixels of at least three colors. Areas painted with ForegroundColor and BackgroundColor are classified as foreground and background areas, while pixels of all other colors are classified as undecided and will be segmented into either foreground or background.
Segmentation is usually an iterative process, where the user keeps improving the AnnotationsSource image until she is happy with the result.

summary.para: An image containing the user annotations for the foreground and the background. Must contain at least one pixel in foreground color and one pixel in background color.
The segmenter will only consider pixels of foreground color or background color, any other color will be treated as unknown.

Default value is blue (A = 255, R = 0, G = 0, B = 255).
The color that represents the foreground annotations in the AnnotationsSource image.
Default value is red (R = 255, G = 0, B = 0).

member.name: M:Nokia.Graphics.Imaging.LensBlurEffect.GetInfoAsync
member.summary: Asynchronously get information about this image provider.
member.returns: An async result with an ImageProviderInfo containing the information.

summary.para: An image source representing a kernel map, specifying which kernel should be used on each pixel.
Each pixel either gets blurred with one of the kernels, or is not blurred and considered to be a part of the focus area.

Kernels are referenced via zero-based indices, e.g. the area that is to be blurred with the first kernel should be referred to by 0, the second kernel by the value of 1 and so forth. Pixels in the focus area should be marked with the value 255.
Kernels used to blur the out of focus areas of the source image.

To create a circle, specify a value for only one dimension and set the other to 0.

member.name: T:Nokia.Graphics.Imaging.ReframingFilter
member.summary: Reframes the image to comprise a rectangle of any size inside or outside the current image. Reframing is done by specifying a reframing area by position and size, an angle of clockwise rotation, and a pivot point around which the reframing area is rotated.

member.name: M:Nokia.Graphics.Imaging.ReframingFilter.#ctor
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new ReframingFilter with default values.

member.name: M:Nokia.Graphics.Imaging.ReframingFilter.#ctor(Windows.Foundation.Rect,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new ReframingFilter with a default pivot point and specified reframing area and angle of rotation.
member.param:
The position and size of the reframing area. If the reframing area has a width or height of 0, this filter will not be applied.
When reframing without rotation, width and height must be in the range [0, 16383].
When reframing with rotation, width and height must be in the range [0, X], where X is in the range [5792, 16383] depending on the reframing area and the source image size. An exception will be thrown during rendering if this limit is exceeded.
The ReframingFilter supports reframing to areas larger than the source or outside of source's bounds. Areas outside the original image are rendered as transparent black pixels, ARGB(0, 0, 0, 0).
Rotation of the reframing area clockwise around the pivot point in degrees.

member.name: M:Nokia.Graphics.Imaging.ReframingFilter.#ctor(Windows.Foundation.Rect,System.Double,Windows.Foundation.Point)
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new ReframingFilter with specified reframing area, angle of rotation, and pivot point.
member.param:
The position and size of the reframing area. If the reframing area has a width or height of 0, this filter will not be applied.
When reframing without rotation, width and height must be in the range [0, 16383].
When reframing with rotation, width and height must be in the range [0, X], where X is in the range [5792, 16383] depending on the reframing area and the source image size. An exception will be thrown during rendering if this limit is exceeded.
The ReframingFilter supports reframing to areas larger than the source or outside of source's bounds. Areas outside the original image are rendered as transparent black pixels, ARGB(0, 0, 0, 0).
Rotation of the reframing area clockwise around the pivot point in degrees.

The point around which rotation is done. Expressed in the unit coordinate space of the reframing area, i.e., the top left corner of the reframing area is at (0.0), and the bottom right corner is at (1, 1).

member.name: P:Nokia.Graphics.Imaging.ReframingFilter.Angle
member.summary:
Rotation of the reframing area clockwise around its top-left corner in degrees.
Default is 0.

member.summary: Internal framework method.
member.param: This parameter is passed internally.

member.summary:
The point around which rotation is done. Expressed in the unit coordinate space of the reframing area, i.e., the top left corner of the reframing area is at (0.0), and the bottom right corner is at (1, 1).
